3971.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ
3971.verse-english: Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder...

3972.verse-arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ
3972.verse-english: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.

clauses-arabic.clause: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ

clauses-english.clause: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.

3973.verse-arabic: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوا وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ
3973.verse-english: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.

clauses-english.clause: How many a generation have We destroyed before them,
but it was not a time for escape.

3974.verse-arabic: وَعَجِبُوا أَن جَاءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ
3974.verse-english: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.

clauses-english.clause: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves.
"This is a magician and a liar.

3975.verse-arabic: أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ
3975.verse-english: Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."

clauses-english.clause: Has he made the gods [only] one God?

3976.verse-arabic: وَانطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ
3976.verse-english: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.

clauses-english.clause: And the eminent among them went forth,
and be patient over [the defense of] your gods.

3977.verse-arabic: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ
3977.verse-english: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.

clauses-english.clause: We have not heard of this in the latest religion.
This is not but a fabrication.

3978.verse-arabic: أَأُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِن بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّن ذِكْرِي ۖ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ
3978.verse-english: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

clauses-english.clause: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?
they are in doubt about My message.
they have not yet tasted My punishment.

3979.verse-arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ
3979.verse-english: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?

clauses-english.clause: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord,

3980.verse-arabic: أَمْ لَهُم مُّلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ
3980.verse-english: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.

clauses-english.clause: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them?
Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.

3981.verse-arabic: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ الْأَحْزَابِ
3981.verse-english: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].

clauses-arabic.clause: جُندٌ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِّنَ الْأَحْزَابِ

clauses-english.clause: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].

3982.verse-arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ
3982.verse-english: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,

clauses-english.clause: The people of Noah denied before them,

3983.verse-arabic: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ
3983.verse-english: And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket. Those are the companies.

clauses-english.clause: And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket.

3984.verse-arabic: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ
3984.verse-english: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.

clauses-english.clause: Each of them denied the messengers,

3985.verse-arabic: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٍ
3985.verse-english: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.

clauses-english.clause: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn];
for it there will be no delay.

3986.verse-arabic: وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ
3986.verse-english: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account"

clauses-english.clause: hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account"

3987.verse-arabic: اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
3987.verse-english: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant,
he was one who repeatedly turned back [to God].

3988.verse-arabic: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ
3988.verse-english: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.

clauses-english.clause: We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him,
exalting [God] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.

3989.verse-english: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].

3990.verse-arabic: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ
3990.verse-english: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ

clauses-english.clause: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.

3991.verse-arabic: ۞ وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ
3991.verse-english: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

clauses-english.clause: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries,
when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

3992.verse-arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ
3992.verse-english: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.

clauses-english.clause: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them?
one of whom has wronged the other,
so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.

3993.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ
3993.verse-english: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."

clauses-english.clause: ' and he overpowered me in speech.

3994.verse-arabic: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِّنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَّا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩
3994.verse-english: [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes.
except for those who believe and do righteous deeds -
" And David became certain that We had tried him,
and he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to God].

3995.verse-arabic: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
3995.verse-english: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

clauses-english.clause: for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

3996.verse-arabic: يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُم بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ
3996.verse-english: [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allah." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of Allah will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.

clauses-english.clause: indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth,
so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire,
as it will lead you astray from the way of God.
those who go astray from the way of God will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.

3997.verse-arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ
3997.verse-english: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.

clauses-english.clause: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly.
That is the assumption of those who disbelieve,
so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.

3998.verse-arabic: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ
3998.verse-english: Or should we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allah like the wicked?

clauses-english.clause: Or should we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land?
Or should We treat those who fear God like the wicked?

3999.verse-arabic: كِتَابٌ أَنزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
3999.verse-english: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

clauses-english.clause: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you,
that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

4000.verse-arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
4000.verse-english: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: And to David We gave Solomon.
indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to God].

4001.verse-arabic: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ
4001.verse-english: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.

clauses-arabic.clause: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ

clauses-english.clause: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.

4002.verse-arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ
4002.verse-english: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."

clauses-english.clause: I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared into the curtain [of darkness].

4003.verse-arabic: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ
4003.verse-english: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking [their] legs and necks.

clauses-english.clause: " and set about striking [their] legs and necks.

4004.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
4004.verse-english: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body; then he returned.

clauses-english.clause: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body;

4005.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَّا يَنبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِّن بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ
4005.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."

clauses-english.clause: forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me.

4006.verse-arabic: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ الرِّيحَ تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ رُخَاءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ
4006.verse-english: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,

clauses-english.clause: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command,

4007.verse-english: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver

4008.verse-english: And others bound together in shackles.

clauses-english.clause: And others bound together in shackles.

4009.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا عَطَاؤُنَا فَامْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
4009.verse-english: [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."

clauses-english.clause: so grant or withhold without account.

4010.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِندَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
4010.verse-english: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

clauses-english.clause: for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

4011.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ
4011.verse-english: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."

clauses-english.clause: when he called to his Lord,
Satan has touched me with hardship and torment.

4012.verse-arabic: ارْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ
4012.verse-english: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for] a cool bath and drink."

clauses-english.clause: this is a [spring for] a cool bath and drink.

4013.verse-arabic: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ
4013.verse-english: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ

clauses-english.clause: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

4014.verse-arabic: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَاضْرِب بِّهِ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَاهُ صَابِرًا ۚ نِّعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ
4014.verse-english: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath." Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath.
he was one repeatedly turning back [to God].

4015.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُولِي الْأَيْدِي وَالْأَبْصَارِ
4015.verse-english: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.

4016.verse-english: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].

clauses-english.clause: We chose them for an exclusive quality:
remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].

4017.verse-english: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.

4018.verse-arabic: وَاذْكُرْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِّنَ الْأَخْيَارِ
4018.verse-english: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.

clauses-english.clause: and all are among the outstanding.

4019.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ
4019.verse-english: This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return

clauses-english.clause: for the righteous is a good place of return

4020.verse-english: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.

clauses-english.clause: whose doors will be opened to them.

4021.verse-arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ
4021.verse-english: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

clauses-english.clause: they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

4022.verse-english: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.

clauses-english.clause: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.

4023.verse-english: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.

clauses-english.clause: are promised for the Day of Account.

4024.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُ مِن نَّفَادٍ
4024.verse-english: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

clauses-english.clause: for it there is no depletion.

4025.verse-english: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

clauses-english.clause: for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

4026.verse-english: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.

clauses-english.clause: and wretched is the resting place.

4027.verse-english: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

4028.verse-english: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

clauses-english.clause: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

4029.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُّقْتَحِمٌ مَّعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُو النَّارِ
4029.verse-english: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."

clauses-english.clause: "This is a company bursting in with you.
they will burn in the Fire.

4030.verse-arabic: قَالُوا بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ
4030.verse-english: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."

4031.verse-arabic: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِي النَّارِ
4031.verse-english: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."

clauses-english.clause: increase for him double punishment in the Fire.

4032.verse-arabic: وَقَالُوا مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ الْأَشْرَارِ
4032.verse-english: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?

clauses-english.clause: "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?

4033.verse-arabic: أَتَّخَذْنَاهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ الْأَبْصَارُ
4033.verse-english: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"

clauses-english.clause: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule,
or has [our] vision turned away from them?

4034.verse-arabic: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ
4034.verse-english: Indeed, that is truth - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

clauses-english.clause: the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

4035.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنذِرٌ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ
4035.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

clauses-english.clause: and there is not any deity except God,

4036.verse-arabic: رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ
4036.verse-english: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."

clauses-english.clause: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them,

4039.verse-arabic: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
4039.verse-english: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

clauses-arabic.clause: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ

clauses-english.clause: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

4040.verse-arabic: إِن يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلَّا أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
4040.verse-english: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."

clauses-english.clause: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner.

4041.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِّن طِينٍ
4041.verse-english: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

clauses-english.clause: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels,
I am going to create a human being from clay.

4042.verse-arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ
4042.verse-english: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

clauses-english.clause: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul,
then fall down to him in prostration.

4043.verse-english: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.

4044.verse-arabic: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ اسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
4044.verse-english: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

4045.verse-arabic: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْعَالِينَ
4045.verse-english: [Allah] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"

clauses-english.clause: what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands?
or were you [already] among the haughty?

4046.verse-arabic: قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِي مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِن طِينٍ
4046.verse-english: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

clauses-english.clause: You created me from fire and created him from clay.

4047.verse-english: [Allah] said, "Then get out of Paradise, for indeed, you are expelled.

4048.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ
4048.verse-english: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."

clauses-english.clause: upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense.

4049.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
4049.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

clauses-english.clause: then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.

4050.verse-english: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

4051.verse-english: Until the Day of the time well-known."

clauses-english.clause: Until the Day of the time well-

4052.verse-english: [Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all

clauses-english.clause: I will surely mislead them all

4053.verse-english: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

4054.verse-english: [Allah] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -

4055.verse-arabic: لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
4055.verse-english: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."

clauses-english.clause: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together.

4056.verse-arabic: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ
4056.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment, and I am not of the pretentious

clauses-english.clause: "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment,
and I am not of the pretentious

4057.verse-english: It is but a reminder to the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: It is but a reminder to the worlds.

4058.verse-english: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."

clauses-english.clause: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time.
